metadata.Title: CVE-2019-1353 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was found in Git before v2.24.1, v2.23.1, v2.22.2, v2.21.1, v2.20.2, v2.19.3, v2.18.2, v2.17.3, v2.16.6, v2.15.4, and v2.14.6. When running Git in the Windows Subsystem for Linux (also known as "WSL") while accessing a working directory on a regular Windows drive, none of the NTFS protections were active.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-1353` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

git - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.7
git-all - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.7
git-arch - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.7
git-core - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.7
git-cvs - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.7
git-daemon-run - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.7
git-daemon-sysvinit - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.7
git-el - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.7
git-email - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.7
git-gui - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.7
git-man - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.7
git-mediawiki - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.7
git-svn - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.7
gitk - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.7
gitweb - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.7
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Nicolas Joly of Microsoft Security Response Center

criterions.comment: git package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.7').
